qas.question: When did people begin to disputre royal hegenomy in Swaziland?
What portion of Swaziland is said to support the monarchy of Swaziland?
What entity took submissions about whether or not Swazi citizens wanted to change support of the monarchy?
What has been debated since the 1970's?
What do progressive formations support besides the current political system?

plausible_answers.text: the monarchy and the current political system

qas.question: What do the majority of citizens complain about?

context: In 2005, <b3_0><b4_0>the constitution<b4_0/><b3_0/> was put into effect. There is still much debate in the country about the constitutional reforms. From <a0_0>the early seventies<a0_0/>, there was active resistance to the royal hegemony. Despite complaints from progressive formations, support for <b5_0><b6_0>the monarchy<b5_0/> and the current political system<b6_0/> remains strong among <a1_0>the majority<a1_0/> of the population.[citation needed] Submissions were made by citizens around the country to commissions, including <a2_0>the constitutional draft committee<a2_0/>, indicating that they would prefer to maintain the current situation.
